KnowledgeBase.Title: Example Character compareLT 010
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: compare compareEQ compareNE compareGT compareGE compareLE

Example.Description: These examples use the compareLT function to compare two objects and return the Boolean value true if the first argument is lesser than the second argument or false if otherwise. The Integer argument is converted into Character values.

Syntax.Note: The character, a, has an ASCII value of 97
